abstract: Testimony at House subcommittee hearing reveals that the Energy Department may have made a decision without precedent when it allowed Solyndra, the now bankrupt solar technology company, to restructure its loans so private investors--not the government-- would first seek its assets in case of liquidation; meeting does not shed light on whether arrangement violated federal law.
snippet: A House subcommittee explored the agreement that put private investors ahead of the government in the event of liquidation.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

lead_paragraph: A House subcommittee explored the agreement that put private investors ahead of the government in the event of liquidation.

headline.main: House Panel Examines Details of Solyndra Deal
headline.print_headline: House Panel Examines Details of Solyndra Deal
headline.seo: Solyndra’s Restructuring Was Unusual, but Illegal? Not Clear
